1. Implementing sustainable manufacturing practices: Reebok can choose to adopt sustainable manufacturing practices that reduce the amount of waste generated during production. This can include using eco-friendly materials, reducing energy and water consumption, and minimizing the use of chemicals and other pollutants.

2. Recycling and reusing materials: Reebok can also incorporate a closed-loop system in its manufacturing processes, where waste materials are recycled and reused as inputs for new products. This can help reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills.

3. Donating or repurposing waste materials: Reebok can also donate excess materials to organizations or initiatives that can repurpose them for different uses, such as making clothing or building materials. This can help reduce the overall amount of waste generated and promote sustainability.

4. Monitoring and measuring waste: Reebok can also track its waste generation and develop metrics to measure its progress towards waste reduction goals. This can help identify areas for improvement and drive continuous improvement in waste management practices.
